pros: Positive work environment, fair pay, great work life balance, many opportunities to advance and enrichment. I also have a great boss.
cons: Can’t think of any negatives. I have heard some people say the pay is low, but I work five hours a week teaching for about 800 a month which to me is awesome.

pros: Nice facility, PTO, and affordable health insurance
cons: Often did work outside of the job description with no compensation

pros: The benefits and retirement are good. Working as a state employee has great perks.
cons: Department of Public Safety is a toxic department. Coworkers are hostile and vulgar. There is rivalry between the shifts. Workplace harassment, bullying, intimidation, and dysfunction are normalized. There is favoritism and a good old boy system by the leadership.

pros: College atmosphere is nice, everyone is very easy-going and it is a good place to gain experience. Great amount of time off.
cons: Low salary, lots of projects have too many cooks in the kitchen.

review_title: Great place to work. Just wish they paid more.
pros: The people here are kind and the work is relaxed. People encourage you to take vacations and there is a good life and work balance. There are no hard or crazy project deadlines here and I haven't had to work over 40 hours a week. The health care benefits are good too. I can go to the doctor with my insurance for a $10 copay or less.
cons:
I wish they were more open to remote work. They recently have had people quit because of this. People want to work here, but we don't want to be stuck living in Bloomington Normal. They will let people work 2 days a week from home, but that's it. A lot of the office and IT jobs can be done from home 100%, so they should let people do that rather than a one size fits all approach.

I work in IT and I make much less than average for my job role. My manager also makes less than average for their role. However, I like the positive environment here.

pros: I enjoy freedom in what and when I want to teach. My supervisor wants to support me in what I do. The technology is up to date and the students are awesome.
cons: We're still in the factory model of education overall and in a conservative community. There's not enough opportunity for me to effect change.

job_title: Vice President, Finance and Administration in Normal, IL
pros: Great education, great value, great facilities and great culture
cons: I have no cons to mention.

job_title: Adult Education Instructor in Normal, IL
pros: Able to fit hours into my schedule.
cons: Unpaid but required professional development in my department.

pros: Friendly staff and coworkers. Students are excellent to work with. Good pay.
cons: Not enough hours. Need supplemental income to work here.

job_title: Front Desk Manager in Normal, IL
pros: Excellent and very friendly supervisors.
cons: Not enough hours to work

pros: Pockets of individuals truly care about student success and living up to the vision, mission, and values of the college; excellent benefits
cons: Poor organizational structure and leadership; limited mobility; lack of diversity and inclusion; toxic people/environments not addressed

review_title: Heartland is a great place to work
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Normal, IL
pros: As a full-time faculty member, I have been very happy at Heartland Community College.  Every year our Union has negotiated very fair raises for us, even in tough economic times, and we also have a good system for promotion.  My Dean is excellent, and I seriously could not ask for a more supportive or competent supervisor.
cons: Some of the Deans at this institution are definitely less than stellar.  Like any workplace, some of the people who work there are great, and some leave a lot to be desired.  Overall, most of the administration is good, or at least competent, with only one or two real disappointments.

pros: The best part about working at HCC was working within Academic Affairs with Deans/Instructors.
cons:
1) The worse part was working with Deans/Directors that were insensitive and unknowledgeable about African American staff and students; transgendered individuals and anything outside of their comfort zone.

2) I was not rewarded for taking on more duties. The only people rewarded are those in their friend zone.

3) The blatant abuse and animosity shown to  those that do not agreed with someone outside of the student affairs Director/Deans group.

pros: learned a lot about processes, continuous improvement and had the freedom to grow in my position as much as I wanted to. Good people mostly.
cons: Poor financial status-public sector. Lack of upward mobility. Incompetent people safely in overpaid positions. Nearly impossible to be fired.

pros: Our program is well-thought-out, colleagues are intelligent and versed in current practice, and we have lots of choice in terms of how we teach.
cons: Instructors have little say in some issues that concern us such as where college is headed & how money is spent.

pros: I loved working in Continuing Education. The employees make you feel as if you are part of the family. The campus is small and quiet. No job was to small or big for me. Thanks for the opportunity!
cons: I loved working at Heartland Community College......cons what cons?!

job_title: Digital Strategist in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Got to build relationships with staff, being in a leadership role, making a difference in the lives of students, and getting very solid in subjects you tutor.
cons: The pay was low and you couldn't get many hours because of work-study limitations.

pros: Good people to work with
cons: Not paid enough for what you go through.

job_title: Student Ambassador and Student Vice President in Normal, IL
pros: Extremely understand and caring environment.
cons: Could be a little more diverse.

pros: Working with ESL students is the best experience anywhere
cons: Restriction on the number of hours you can work

pros: Love the people and positive energy at Heartland Community College.
cons: There isn't a promotion system for employees.

job_title: Math Success Center Facilitator & Faculty in Peoria, IL
pros: Excellent place to work. People are very nice.
cons: Subject to state Budget problems and in action at Springfield,IL.

job_title: Executive Director, Non-Profit in Normal, IL
pros: Great colleagues and excellent benefits
cons: Limited advancement opportunities in some areas

pros: None they don't care about the instructors
cons: No structure and no leadership the school only cares about making money.
